Preferably taking the piece would have been better - 6...Kxf7 7 Qb3+ d5 8. Qxb4 Nxe4 9. Re8 and Black has a good game.
White is going all out and trying to see how long it takes for Black to crack under the pressure. Maybe 8. Nge2, completing developing and castling, before launching this attack.

Ruh Roh...Black himself makes a huge error that could give White a huge advantage, but unfortunately, White immediately crumbles. 18...Qf8! keeps Black's advantage - White would be a piece down and would have to trade queens to avoid being mated.

(??) - White makes a bad error. He should have played 19. Kh4! and Black is faced with his problems, including Qxf6+, Qe6 and Rxc8#. He would give up the knight and in the long run, would be a rook down - White would have a big advantage.
(??) White now loses. He should have played 20. Kf3. In the resulting analysis, he would have to give up his queen, but his first blunder made his position hopeless.
